data.title: Bell Atlantic
data.meta_description: According to Eddie Murphy, Axel Foley needed to grow up for a fourth Beverly Hills Cop movie.
data.text:
Bell Atlantic Description Industry: Technology Type: Telecommunications Years Active: 1984-2000 Defunct Reason: Merger

Bell Atlantic is a former telecommunications brand.

History[]

Bell Atlantic was one of seven 'Baby Bell' companies that were created as a result of the the Bell System breakup in 1984.

The company remained independent and operated in it's own respective region of the United States until 1995, when they made a joint venture with Nynex, another Baby Bell company that operated in a different region. Said joint venture consisted of the two combining both of their cellular operations into a new company known as 'Bell Atlantic NYNEX Mobile.'[1][2]

Bell Atlantic would later acquire the NYNEX company as a whole in 1997, with it being dissolved in favor of their own brand.[3]After the acquisition, Bell Atlantic would expand into 7 new states, all of which previously being Nynex's territory.

They would repeat this process again in 2000,[4] this time with the telecommunications company GTE. Unlike the previous deal with Nynex however, instead of one company absorbing the other, both companies would merge together to create one new company. This new company would be the current day Verizon, one of the main competitors to AT&T and T-Mobile.[5][6]
